Position Title: Junior Business Analyst
Team and Location: IT – Calgary, AB
Position Summary:
The Junior Business Analyst will be responsible for supporting a variety of applications and processes, ensuring a positive experience of the organization’s customers, partners, suppliers, and employees. The role includes managing content standards, coordinating global changes, and working with users to maintain systems they support. This position will work with business and other IT users to understand the underlying business processes and related technical processes of systems they support to implement and deliver enhancements.
Key Responsibilities:
Responsible for completing requests and tasks in a variety of supported applications.
Acts as IT liaison for internal and external contacts related to assigned systems.
Interacts and coordinates with the business to understand and document business requirements.
Actively involved in and contributes throughout the SDLC process and/or Change Approval Board Process.
Responsible for analysis, translation, and simplification of business requirements to technical and functional requirements.
Assists business with developing business cases.
Incident Management, provide assistance with diagnosis and resolution of production issues.
Provides Subject Matter Expert (SME) knowledge to the prioritizing process for business requests.
Qualifications and Skills:
Post-secondary education in Computer Science would be an asset however relevant experience or related education would also be considered.
Knowledge of change management methodology.
Knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle.
Business Analyst Certification would be an asset.
Analytical problem solving.
Technical writing skills.
Effective communication for technical and non-technical audiences.

In-house learning and development opportunities, leadership training, international opportunities.

A safety focused work environment and ongoing safety training.

Job Description
What You’ll Be Doing
As a Junior Analyst, you will work on a team of consultants to primarily support managing service and access requests from various LOB’s on/off boarding new staff . You will be equally acting as a consultant on a variety of projects and accelerators representing Simplii’s operations teams, its interfaces, back office functions and the related systems on which we depend.
At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. Details on your work arrangement will be discussed at the time of your interview.
How You’ll Succeed
Application of your Deep Knowledge - Using your years of experience with Simplii and material technical knowledge to resolve client escalations that could not be resolved through our front line channels while looking for trends and eliminating recurrence when possible.
Successful Project Delivery – Consult on a variety of projects, initiatives and accelerators driving the requirements and solution ensuring they are compliant, effective and have the client at the forefront.
Active Program Support – Develop procedures from established process, create user documentation and provide training support.
Implementation support – Verification of changes in production to ensure there is no client impact and all is operating as designed.
Who you are:
 You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do.
 You're driven to succeed. You are motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make an impact.
 You engage with your heart and mind. You care about people and understand different perspectives. You listen and learn from the experiences of others.
 You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
 You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
What CIBC offers
At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.
We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers , our social, points-based recognition program .
Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients .
We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development
What you need to know

Business Systems Analyst

Location: work from home, across Canada,
Type of contract: Temporary (12 months) Full Time

Salary band: $61,113 - $89,122


An iconic brand and one of the most inspirational not-for-profit organizations on this planet – The Canadian Red Cross (CRC), is seeking Business Systems Analyst to join our Information Services team.
You want to be part of the world’s largest humanitarian network? You have a passion for helping others, and want to work with other dedicated individuals? By applying, you are taking a big first step to be part of an exciting organization that makes a huge difference in the lives of Canadians here at home and abroad. What are you waiting for?


 At the Canadian Red Cross, we help people and communities in Canada and around the world in times of need and support them in strengthening their resilience. We are committed to having an accessible, diverse, and inclusive work environment where people with all abilities, ethnicities, gender identities and expressions, nationalities, religions, and sexual orientations can reach their full potential. All qualified persons, particularly Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, ethnic minorities, visible minorities, women, veterans, and others who share our values and contribute to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace are encouraged to apply.


We are looking for a Business Systems Analyst, you will work with the Manager, Business Systems Analysis. You will play a key role in performing business and systems analysis activities through bridging both domains: business and technology. Based on breadth and depth of understanding of business needs and processes, you will collaborate with technical teams to determine and implement appropriate solutions.

As Business Systems Analyst you will:

Own and lead end-to-end all aspects of requirements management and traceability.
Elicit, document, and analyze business and stakeholder requirements and transform them into system requirements.
Create and maintain business process models (Use Cases and Business Process Model & Notation (BPMN) process flows), conceptual and logical data models, etc.
Research, evaluate and provide input regarding proposed IT solutions and collaborate closely with project teams to implement the requirements.
Work within a matrix organization reporting within Information Services, closely collaborating with support services such as project management office and other internal client groups.
Provide necessary guidance to testers during quality Assurance (QA) process, develop and execute test plans as required; investigate problems and recommend resolution options.
Support the IT change management process and perform system configuration as required.
Prepare user and technical documentation e.g. ‘how to’ documents and deliver training at the train-the-trainer level.
Identify opportunities for improvement in the delivery of business system analysis services and recommend changes if appropriate


What we are looking for:

University Degree (Computer Science, Information Management Systems, or related field preferred) or equivalent certification or experience.
5+ years of experience in business and system analysis in a project environment.
Excellent communication skills, with a proven ability to communicate to both technical and non-technical staff
Experience in process, function, and data modeling (Unified Modeling Language (UML) or BPMN experience desirable)
Experience conducting stakeholder interviews and product demos.
Experience with scrum processes and as well as being on a scrum team working with Developers is a definitel asset.
Experience with business need analysis and data-driven professional presentations is highly desirable;
Software skills: Dynamics AX 2012 et Dynamics 365 Finance. IIBA CBAP or PMI PBA certification is an asset.
French is a definite asset


Working conditions:
Some travel across Canada may be required for meeting with clients, stakeholders, or off-site personnel/management.
Full vaccination against COVID-19 is mandatory for this position and operation (the CRC will however adhere to its duty to accommodate those who are unable to be fully vaccinated for a reason related to a human right protected ground).


The Canadian Red Cross is an organization guided by our fundamental principles of humanity, impartiality, neutrality, independence, voluntary service, unity and universality. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you require accommodation measures during any phase of the hiring process, please notify us as soon as possible. All information received in relation to accommodation requests will be kept confidential.

Job Title: Senior Performance and Business Intelligence Analyst
Job Description:
Senior Performance and Business Intelligence Analyst
GAME ON – OLG needs you
We’ve said GAME ON, and we mean it – OLG is rapidly transforming its organization to better serve Ontarians by delivering great gaming experiences through our digital, retail lottery, and land-based casino channels. In our fiscal 2019-20 year alone, OLG delivered over $2.3 billion in net profit to the Province of Ontario. OLG is now expanding our horizons even further, with a new strategic direction, to become a world class gaming entertainment leader with a globally admired digital platform.
The Senior Performance and Business Intelligence Analyst is a key support role that is critical to the success of the Customer Care strategic plan. You will work closely with the management team to identify areas of opportunity within Customer Care based on performance, call drivers and key performance indicators. This role is responsible for interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques, providing reports, developing and implementing data analyses, using data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
YOUR ROLE IN THE GAME
Reporting to the Senior Manager Resource Planning & Optimization you will be empowered to:
Showcase Your Expertise
Identify opportunities and implement approved strategies to reduce, maintain or improve service level, drive performance and process improvements to meet targets
Develop actionable insights that can be used to optimize strategy by building reports, dashboards, decision-optimization tools, and visualizations (using Python/R, SQL, Tableau/PowerBI)
Deliver weekly, monthly and quarterly insights based on reports (WFM and performance indicators) and support the quarterly target setting process
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets to create models that depict trends in WFM and Customer Care performance metrics and correlate them with OLG business metrics as a whole.
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing calculations and data sources for ongoing and new reports to locate and correct data inconsistencies
Curate and maintain all telephony and routing records pertaining to routing, IVR and ICE
Analyze historical trends as they relate to impact on future decisions and recommendations.
Use the Workforce/Telepoth/PBIi and other Customer Care systems to effectively produce required reports
Generate Insights and Build Relationships
Develop a deep understanding of our current business processes and collaborate with the lines of business on continuous improvement initiatives
Build Relationship with the management team to prioritize business and information needs to leverage and extend existing analytical research
WHAT YOU NEED TO PLAY
Work Experience: 3+ years of relevant experience in a similar role; experience with Workforce Management Scheduling Software, Python/R, SQL, PowerBI/Tableau, Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Education: Post-secondary degree or diploma in Business, Math, Statistics, or other related field
Skills & Knowledge: Understanding of workforce management, performance analytics and applications; knowledge of contact center best practices, performance measurement, quality improvement and vendor performance management; technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques; competent in conducting various types of independent analysis including skills in data collection, cleaning and analysis and the ability to extract and present insights and findings; ability to interpret data, identify trends, solve complex problems and identify process improvement opportunities; advanced proficiency using Python, SQL and Microsoft Office tools is a MUST, skilled in various WFM, support operations and reporting tools and technology (i.e. Aspect, IEX, PowerBI, JiRa, Salesforce, Tableau, Workday, Calabrio)
Results Driven : Builds positive working relationships, communicates clearly, meets deadlines and delivers quality work; flexibility to work outside of regular business hours in a 24 x 365 environment
Negotiation and Influence : well-developed interpersonal skills, ability to negotiate and influence effectively while being open to perspectives and maintaining strong relationships
Strategic Thinker : strong strategic and critical thinker with ability to delve into unique challenges and find creative solutions
Collaboration & fun : inclusive and collaborative work style while creating fun and excitement in our work
Integrity and trust : do what's right and operate with transparency and openness
Licenses, Registrations, Certificates:
AGCO Category 2 Gaming Assistant Registration (Initiated at offer stage - employment is conditional upon obtaining and maintaining this license)

PERKS OF JOINING OUR TEAM
Part of a Bigger Picture: socially responsible company that gives back all its profits to the province and people of Ontario
Flexible Work Environment: to help balance both work and life
You Matter: family friendly work practices and remote work
Freedom to Innovate: supports new and better ways to be successful
Be your Authentic Self: environment that values diversity as a source of strength
Learning Galore: 24-7 access to robust online learning programs
Public Service Pension Plan: participate in a major defined benefit pension plan sponsored by the Government of Ontario

Data Analyst
Job Number : 42496
Under the direction of the Manager, Fleet Analytics, this position provides analytical support for the Fleet & Facility Services branch by developing and analyzing business reports. The position will be responsible for all aspects of research, data collection, modeling, blending, reporting and analysis for various client groups.
The position is expected to learn about the branch business and use this knowledge to work with representatives to identify specific reporting requirements. This means learning the associated processes within the business, as well as understanding the underlying data structure for the specified technologies used by the branch. Using this knowledge, the position is a partner with the business, providing initial analysis on the results. The reports are significant aid to the business as they enable various business areas to make data driven decisions.
With a focus on the City of Edmonton’s Cultural Commitments to Safe, Helpful, Accountable, Integrated and Excellent, you will:
Use a variety of systems (SAP, M5, PeopleSoft, Visier, Tririga, GPS software, Google Sheets, Microsoft Access, Microsoft Excel) to collect, organize and blend data
Work with the clients to identify business requirements, map processes, and create reports
Identify data issues; work with the business and IT to recommend solutions, initiate resolutions
Research data models and software
Work with the business to identify trends and anomalies within operations
Recommend new reports for the client based on understanding of the business
Identify scope of work for new reports
Build effective working relationships with the network of stakeholders within the branch
Seek validation from a variety of perspectives to continuously improve the accuracy of the analysis
Prepare and present narratives and explanations to accompany statistical data
Create reports
Create documentation for the reports including logic, methodologies and business signoff
Create test scripts and conducts testing to ensure accurate reporting
Manage the development and staging of the reports through the report development lifecycle, adhering to protocols within the business area
Prepare monthly reporting for internal and external clients
Prepare ad hoc reports for clients
Research new technologies
Research new reporting styles and techniques including visual presentation best practices
Coach and mentor other members of the team to enhance team capabilities
Assist with the development of standard practices and processes for data collection
Monitor error reports and investigate recurring problems
Perform other related duties as required
Qualifications :
University Degree in Commerce (specializing in Information Systems, Operations Management, or similar), Computer Science, Finance, or Statistics from a recognized educational institution
Minimum 2 years experience in an operational or fleet and facility environment, with a focus on process flow, performance and financial measurement
Proficiency in modeling, operational and statistical research
Strong mathematical skills with the ability to interpret data
Proficiency with SQL
Proficiency with Google Suite, experience in Tableau and dashboard presentation tools an asset
Ability to express ideas and concepts effectively, both oral and written
Ability to work independently under broad direction
Knowledge of work methods, studies and analytical procedures, practices and terminology related to the Fleet and Facility Services businesses
Ability to prepare and present technical briefs and reports
This position will work out of a facility that is not accessible via public transportation. A valid Class 5 licence and access to personal transportation will be required
Applicants may be tested

Overview
Forward Together:
Drive Innovation with N-able.

The Business Analyst, Commissions/Finance Operations excels in data analysis and can both identify, facilitate and communicate change to achieve efficiency and high performance across the global Sales Team. This is an engaging and hands-on role that requires an individual who is capable of functioning and excelling at both a strategic and data-heavy position. Of the various initiatives, the Business Analyst will focus on commission planning.
Responsibilities:
Provide front line support to the sales organization by solving issues with order management and navigating internal processes to generate and book orders
Leverage knowledge of existing process structure to identify common issues & trends to develop proactive solutions
Ability to identify quote-to-cash process bottlenecks through analysis of day to day work

Data deep-dives to find pockets of opportunities for our business

Partner with other teams within the business (Revenue Operations, Business Applications etc.) on Sales Enablement projects

Experience of working within Sales Operations or a Business Analyst role in a software sales organization
Experience of being in a role supporting Sr. Sales Leadership and/or FP&A
Strong listening, analytic and organizational skills
Experience of Xactly or similar sales commission tool preferred

Work from home, office or both

We are looking for an Agile Business Analyst to join our Casino Development team in Richmond Hill!
This role follows a hybrid approach to working, allowing you to combine working from home with working in our modern offices. These discussions are between you and your manager to find the best pattern for you both! We will kit you out to work from home but know that working as a team is what makes us great and spending quality time together is important for keeping us mission-aligned.
Are you our next star player?
The Business Analyst is the liaison between business stakeholders and development team during the whole development life cycle process. The BSA will assist Product Owner and Product Managers in defining requirements and will become the functional SME of the new feature, product and/or system that is being added to our world class casino gaming platform.
Why we need you
In this role you will help define and deliver solutions that meet business objectives, and will serve as a facilitator between the business and IT in understanding the business’s needs. In partnership with Product Owners, Product Managers, Senior Business Analysts and other interfacing groups you will lead the eliciting, analyzing, validating and managing of requirements, business processes and high-level solution designs.
Responsibilities:
Elicits, analyzes, specifies, and validates the business needs of stakeholders.
Collaborates with project sponsors to set project scope and vision.
Conducts interviews to gather requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
Works with squad to prioritize collected requirements.
Researches, reviews, and analyzes the effectiveness and efficiency of existing requirements-gathering processes and develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes.
Assists in conducting research on products to meet agreed upon requirements and to support purchasing efforts.
Analyzes and verifies requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards.
Develops and utilizes standard templates to accurately and concisely write requirements specifications.
Translates conceptual product requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to the business/developers/project team.
Creates process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the squad.
Develops and conduct peer reviews of the business requirements to ensure that requirement specifications are correctly interpreted.
Manages and tracks the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary.
Communicates changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements — verbally or through written documentation — to squad, product owner, scrum master, sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.
Who we’re looking for
We are looking for an individual with a solid grasp of the SDLC in an agile environment and is comfortable working with international multi-functional teams!
Your experience:
College diploma or university degree in the field of business administration, finance, or information systems
Three to five years related work experience
Proven experience with business and technical requirement's analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology development
Demonstrated Agile skills and project management software skills, including planning, organizing, and managing resources
Working knowledge of Office suite of products, Jira, Confluence,
Your skills:
Able to exercise independent judgment and take action on it
Excellent analytical, mathematical, and creative problem-solving skills
Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills
Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail
Highly self-motivated and directed
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Agile and Scrum experience
What’s in it for you?
Our experience-based salaries are competitive. Plus, there’s a discretionary annual performance bonus.
Your package will include:
Health and dental insurance for you, your partner and your children (if you all live at the same address)
A personal interest allowance to let you learn something new or pursue a hobby
Looking to extend your family? You will receive a cash gift of $1,900 for your new addition whilst working for us
Discounts on local gyms, restaurants and events
Free snacks and catered lunch
In-house training and development to develop your skills, progressing your career

PokerStars is part of Flutter Entertainment Plc, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider headquartered in Dublin and part of the FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange. Flutter brings together exceptional brands, products and businesses and a diverse global presence in a safe, responsible and ultimately sustainable way.

We will aim to respond to you as soon as possible. If you’re the right fit for the role, you will be invited to a phone/zoom interview.

We are looking for a Lead Business Analyst.
The Health and Dental Claim Solutions team is looking for an experienced, and passionate Lead Business Analyst with experience in business analysis of large-scale projects. The Business Analyst position is an exciting role that is pivotal in achieving our vision to become the best provider of health and dental solutions. This position allows you to work with many different teams within our Health and Dental organization and larger Group Division.
The Lead business analyst works on projects along with our Group Technology partners and various teams within the Group division to transform our operation. This position is suited to an individual who enjoys working in an environment with complex problems, challenging deadlines, drives problems to conclusion and has the desire to become a business and technical expert in the organization.
What you will do
Actively participate in the creation of project business cases including cost benefit analysis as required to determine prioritization of projects and solutions.
Contribute to successful project completion within budget and on time by identifying risks and recommending mitigation strategies.
Facilitate stakeholder engagement through effective workshops and interviews to identify and document business needs.
Collaborate with GCT to ensure understanding of the business requirements, use cases and business designs, and obtain sign off on the various elements to ensure solution delivery is appropriate and meets the needs of the business.
Being a subject matter expert for our Health and Dental Systems
Create test plans and evaluate test case outcome including the documentation of results and defects
Presenting recommendations to senior leaders in the organization.
Leading resources on larger projects, providing guidance and direction to team members. May include developing a formal project plan, monitoring and managing the plan to ensure deadlines are met and project objective is achieved.
Coach, mentor and support the development of Business Analysts on assigned projects
Support Learning and Development with the development of internal training material.
What you will bring
Post-secondary education related to business. Other degrees that demonstrate focus on critical thinking are also valuable.
Demonstrated Business Analysis experience (5+ years)
Solution focused – enjoys the challenge of problem solving.
An enthusiastic team player who enjoys sharing knowledge, experience and ideas, and is open to the ideas and input of others
Well-developed verbal and written communication skills, able to tailor communication style to the audience.
Commitment to self development.
Experience in coaching, training or assisting other staff.
Knowledge of Group Health & Dental claims and Group Insurance systems is a definite asset.
Effective time management skills; Able to work independently and manage multiple deadlines/projects
Experience in applying skills using Word, Excel, Access and Visio software.

Req Id: 345592
At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content - we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.
If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
Our Bell Business Markets team enables the digital transformation of businesses and governments nationwide through solutions in areas including Internet and private networks, voice and unified communications, contact centre, security, Internet of Things, data centre and cloud. We’re proud to be Canada’s leading provider of broadband network and communication services for businesses and governments.
Our Business Intelligence Team within BBM provides reporting and analytical insight to Product, Marketing, and Sales teams to support day-to-day operations and strategic planning. The team plays an integral role in decision-making at multiple levels of management through complex analyses, predictive modeling, data definition and standardization, data mining, reporting, as well as sourcing external data from 3rd party relationships.
Position Overview:
Working with a Senior Project Manager, you will be responsible to identify and analyze business problems and define the scope of activities required to address the issues, including requirement definition, process review, impact assessment and operational streamlining. The successful candidate will collaborate closely with team members, and partner teams to implement assigned projects in alignment with PMO methodology and standards.
Accountabilities and Responsibilities:
The Business Analyst applies project management life cycle methodologies, tools, and best practices, ensuring that appropriate documentation, change, and risk management practices are in place. Business Analyst will apply analytical knowledge and experience to identify and document business requirements, workflows, functional requirements, use cases, test and training plans in collaboration with stakeholders.
Elicit and document business requirements in collaboration with stakeholders, and ensure they accurately reflect stakeholder needs and align with corporate standards
Analyze business and user needs, document business requirements, and product and process specifications
Create technical needs documentation, and demonstrate these requirements to the technical and business team as and when needed
Map/ Document current state workflows, decomposing high level information into details and abstracting up from low level information, and maintain reference information (Visio maps, guides, policies, step action documents)
Review change requests, track the effect of requirement changes over the business, functional and technical process, and communicate to all participants
Develop, document and recommend future state workflows and identify impact of revised workflows on current operations
Track issues and collaborate with the Project Stakeholders to resolve issues
Conduct root-cause analysis of existing operational gaps and failures, provide business impact analysis including risks assessments, and recommend possible solutions
Establish excellent working relationships with project team members, stakeholders and internal Subject Matter Experts
Contribute to the ongoing development and refinement of PMO standards and methodologies
Preferred Qualifications/Competencies:
University Degree or College Diploma in Business Analysis, Project Management or a combination of related education and experience
3-5 years of project experience with at least 2 years of experience as a Business Analyst is required; PMO environment experience preferred
Effective communicator with solid verbal and written communication skills to facilitate stakeholder collaboration, articulate needs and the rationale for change, clarifying expressed desires to determine underlying issues and causes, and designing solutions that deliver value
Skilled modeler and conceptualizer, experienced in process mapping and work-flow analysis, equipped with innovative design and presentation skills to express ideas and facts in a clear and understandable manner – tailoring and adapting communication to the intended audience (technical and non-technical)
Ability to adapt to constantly moving priorities and focus on the highest ones and meet deadlines
Demonstrated self-starter, able to assess opportunities and provide creative solutions
Able to think independently and consider cross-functional and downstream impacts
Detail oriented with strong analytical and problem solving skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Visio, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project and Outlook)
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or Project Management Institute Certified (PBA) or is an asset
Bilingualism is an asset (English and French); adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.

Job Title: Analyste de systèmes opérationnels - Business Systems Analyst
Job Description:
Analyste de systèmes opérationnels

Localisation : n’importe où au Canada (en télétravail)

Type de contrat : Temporaire (12 mois) à temps plein

Échelle salariale : 61 113 $ à 89 122 $ par an


La Croix-Rouge canadienne (CRC), organisme à but non lucratif des plus réputés et inspirants au monde, est à la recherche d’un ou d’une analyste de systèmes opérationnels pour œuvrer au sein de son équipe des Services d’information.


Désirez-vous faire partie du plus vaste réseau humanitaire au monde? Aider les autres est l’une de vos passions et vous aimeriez travailler avec des personnes tout aussi dévouées que vous? En soumettant votre candidature, vous franchirez la première étape du processus qui pourrait vous mener à intégrer une organisation dynamique qui transforme la vie de personnes au Canada et à l’étranger. N’attendez plus!


La Croix-Rouge canadienne aide les personnes et les communautés dans le besoin tant au Canada que dans le monde et contribue à renforcer leur résilience. Nous nous engageons à offrir à notre main-d’œuvre diversifiée un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible, dans lequel tous et toutes peuvent s’épanouir, indépendamment de leurs capacités, de leur origine ethnique, de leur identité et expression de genre, de leur nationalité, de leur religion et de leur orientation sexuelle. Nous encourageons toutes les personnes qualifiées à postuler, particulièrement les personnes autochtones, les personnes ayant des limitations fonctionnelles, les personnes faisant partie de minorités ethniques ou visibles, les femmes, les anciens combattants et anciennes combattantes, ainsi que toute autre personne partageant nos valeurs et notre volonté de favoriser un milieu de travail inclusif et diversifié.


Nous sommes à la recherche d’un ou d’une analyste de systèmes opérationnels.Collaborant avec la gestionnaire, Analyse des systèmes opérationnels vous jouerez un rôle clé dans l’analyse des opérations et des systèmes en conjuguant les domaines de la gestion et de la technologie. En vous basant sur votre profonde compréhension des besoins et processus d’affaires, vous collaborerez avec les équipes techniques pour trouver les solutions les mieux adaptées et les mettre en œuvre.


En tant que Analyste de systèmes opérationnels, vous allez:

Assurer la responsabilité et la direction de l’ensemble des aspects liés à la gestion et à la traçabilité des exigences.
Obtenir, consigner et analyser les exigences des opérations et des parties concernées, et les traduire en exigences système.
Créer et mettre à jour des modèles de processus opérationnels (cas d’usage et modélisation des processus à l’aide de la méthode BPMN [Business Process Model & Notation]), ainsi que des modèles de données conceptuelles, logiques, etc.
Faire des recherches sur les solutions technologiques proposées, les évaluer et formuler des recommandations; collaborer étroitement avec les équipes de projet pour mettre en œuvre les exigences.
Travailler au sein de l’environnement matriciel des Services d’information en collaborant étroitement avec les services de soutien notamment le Bureau de gestion de projets et d’autres groupes clients internes.
Assurer l’encadrement nécessaire des responsables des essais au cours du processus d’assurance qualité et élaborer et exécuter des protocoles d’essai au besoin; faire enquête sur les problèmes et recommander des options de résolution.
Appuyer le processus de gestion du changement des technologies de l’information (TI) et effectuer la configuration de systèmes, selon les besoins.
Préparer du matériel technique destiné aux utilisateurs et aux utilisatrices (p. ex. des documents explicatifs) et former les formateurs et les formatrices.
Cerner les occasions d’amélioration dans la prestation des services d’analyse des systèmes opérationnels, et recommander des changements, s’il y a lieu.
Profil recherché :

Être titulaire d’un diplôme universitaire (en informatique, en systèmes de gestion de l’information, ou dans une discipline connexe de préférence) ou posséder une combinaison équivalente d’études et d’expérience.
Posséder plus de cinq ans d’expérience en analyse des opérations et des systèmes dans un environnement de projet.
Posséder d’excellentes compétences en communication, et pouvoir communiquer aussi bien avec le personnel technique que non technique.
Posséder de l’expérience en modélisation de processus, de fonctions et de données (expérience avec le langage de modélisation UML ou BPMN souhaitée).
Avoir de l’expérience en réalisation d’entrevues avec des parties prenantes et en démonstration de produits.
Avoir de l’expérience dans la mise en œuvre de logiciels de gestion de l’apprentissage et du capital humain (HCM) constitue un atout.
Avoir de l’expérience avec les logiciels Dynamics AX 2012 et Dynamics 365 Finance et Opérations est hautement souhaitable; être titulaire de la certification CBAP (Certified Business Analysis Professional) de l’IIBA ou PBA (Professional in Business Analysis) du PMI constitue un atout.
Maîtriser l’anglais à l’oral et à l’écrit; la maîtrise du français est un atout.


Conditions de travail :
La personne retenue pourrait avoir à se rendre un peu partout au Canada pour rencontrer des client(e)s, des intervenant(e)s, du personnel ou des gestionnaires hors site.
La vaccination complète contre la COVID-19 est obligatoire pour ce poste et cette opération (la Croix-Rouge canadienne respectera toutefois son obligation de permettre un accommodement aux personnes qui ne peuvent pas être vaccinées pour une raison liée à un motif de protection des droits de la personne).

Nous nous engageons à offrir un environnement de travail inclusif et sans obstacles, en commençant par le processus d'embauche. Toutes les informations reçues en rapport avec les demandes d'adaptation seront gardées confidentielles.

Company Description
AV-BASE Systems, Inc. (dba WinAir) is a proud developer and supporter of structurally integrated and cost-efficient maintenance and inventory control systems for over 25 years. With our head office in London, Ontario, we provide WinAir software to over 250 operators (fixed- and rotary-wing) worldwide.
Celebrating our 30th anniversary, WinAir was also recognized by the local business community during the London Chamber of Commerce Business Achievement Awards, as the winner of the Business of the Year award in the medium-sized category in 2018.
Would you like to become a part of an award-winning company that is growing more than ever? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment? Are you looking for opportunities for growth in different job functions? Then shout out to us!

Job Description
Reporting to Tech Review Manager, you will be a proactive enthusiastic team member and be primarily responsible for gathering, analyzing, specifying, and validating the company's business needs. This includes interviewing users and gathering/compiling user requirements to convey to the Development team throughout the entire software lifecycle, testing and training. The BA's support is critical to our development process by ensuring that project deliverables are met according to specifications.
Principal Accountabilities
Gather and document requirements and ideas from different internal user groups.
Develop an understanding of business needs through discussion and interviews.
Review enhancement requests and customer inquiries.
Assess customers’ needs, identify and document requirements critical to achieving business objectives.
Create the functional requirements along with user interface requirements.
Recommend and communicate solutions to specific business problems and improvements to business processes.
Assist with Release Videos and Online Help update and maintenance.
Participate in beta testing as required.
Other ad hoc duties as assigned.

Qualifications

3 – 5 years of experience as Business Analyst or similar role
Experience in technical writing and/or document management is preferred.
Experience working with users developing business requirements
Experience with process management and process change implementation
Effective business case writing skills
Ability to learn new software quickly
Strong analytical mindset to understand a business problem and break it down into resolvable understandable pieces
Efficient problem solving skills, with the ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines
Effective communication skills (both verbal and written) to act as a professional and inquisitive liaison
Proficient skills and experience in Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Product roadmap experience ability to elicit mid- and long-term product plans
Familiarity with SDLC/CMM/ISO principles
Familiarity with estimating and resourcing processes
Aviation experience/knowledge a plus, as is fluency in other languages
Additional Information
Why Work for Us?
We offer competitive compensation and benefits (e.g., extended health, dental, EAP, RRSP, etc.) based on experience and a proven track record of success, relative to the deliverables of the role.
We are proud to offer a flexible work schedule maximizing good work-life balance, different social committee events and quarterly Town Hall meetings to foster teamwork and a strong, long-lasting work relationship.
Do you want to hear more about what we can offer? Why not check out our website and see what is available? We are hiring for different roles and would love to hear from qualified individuals like yourself!

THE COMPANY

Riptide Fulfillment is a privately-held national supplier of decorative plumbing products, based in the Greater Toronto Area. We are focused on serving Canada’s leading wholesale distributors, e-commerce companies, and big box retailers so they can exceed their customers’ expectations with the fastest and most enjoyable product fulfillment experience. Our service commitment is built on a foundation of integrity and drive to build powerful partnerships with our customers and vendors.

The Riptide business is founded by industry professionals committed to building a trailblazing team of individuals with a profound quest for learning, passion for the customer and genuine commitment to living our core values: Fairness and Caring, Trust and Respect, Generous Listening, Straight Talk. We are building this company with both a great respect for the core tenets of distribution and a fresh perspective on how to make a meaningful difference within a mature industry.

THE OPPORTUNITY

Our Business Analysts love to solve problems! Their natural analytical way of thinking takes complex process and data challenges and transforms them into precise, creative, smart and highly effective solutions. They understand the intricacies of the business better than anyone, and embrace every opportunity to enrich the customer experience. The Junior Business Analyst may be responsible for enterprise-wide analytics on business performance, and may serve as an Account Manager to a customer requiring detailed analytics or digital content.

Junior Business Analyst Responsibilities:

Embrace the business from start to finish: anticipate business requirements, develop processes, uncover opportunities for improvement, and implement solutions
Lead ongoing reviews of business processes and develop optimization strategies
Conduct meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings
Effectively communicate insights and plans to cross-functional teammates
Work closely with customers from on-boarding to continuing relationship management
Provide leadership, training, coaching, and guidance to fellow teammates
Manage projects, prepare forecasts, develop project plans, and monitor performance
Prioritize initiatives based on business needs and requirements
Monitor solutions and ensure timely completion of projects


We expect our Junior Business Analyst to possess:

Strong core values and integrity
A bachelor’s degree in business, economics or any related field
3+ years of experience in a fast-paced business environment
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
A knack for identifying process improvement opportunities and a passion for executing on these opportunities
Rock-star skills in Microsoft applications including Excel, Word, and Outlook
Knowledge of statistical programming and data visualization is an asset
A track record of following through on commitments
Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills
Bilingualism (French, English) is not required, but highly valued


Riptide’s commitment to you:

You will learn how to build and run a business. Growth opportunities will be plentiful!
Competitive base compensation and an industry-leading profit sharing opportunity
Comprehensive Benefits and Wellness programs
Optional Pension Plan and Group RRSP

 Interested candidates should e-mail us at jointheteam@riptide.ca

Riptide is an equal opportunity employer and committed to maintaining a barrier free workplace where all employees can contribute to their fullest potential. We welcome applications from women and men including members of visible minorities, aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities.
To apply for this job email your details to jointheteam@riptide.ca.

Job Title: SP-08 - Senior Supply Business Analyst (equivalent to PG-04, AS-05 & PM-05)
Job Description:
For a description of key terms used on CRA job notices, go to Definitions for job seekers.
About the job
On October 6, 2021, the Government of Canada announced details of its plans to require vaccination across the federal public service. As a separate and large federal employer, the Canada Revenue Agency (CRA) supports and will follow this new policy direction.
As of November 8, 2021, all employees of the CRA, including new hires, are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless accommodated based on a medical contraindication, religion, or another prohibited ground for discrimination as defined under the Canadian Human Rights Act and attest to their vaccination status.
The requirement to be fully vaccinated applies to all employees and new hires, whether they are teleworking, working remotely or working on-site. This condition of employment applies to indeterminate (permanent), determinate (term), and student hiring. Should you reach the point in the staffing process where it is necessary to verify conditions of employment, there will be a requirement to complete an attestation of vaccination status.
CRA prioritizes diversity and inclusion and is firmly committed to providing a diverse workforce that reflects the population we serve. CRA’s National Employment Equity (EE) Staffing Strategy strives to eliminate EE gaps for the four EE designated groups: Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and women. Where an EE gap exists at the time of appointment, EE may be used as an appointment criterion for permanent and temporary appointments/staffing actions over six months made through this process.
Key Activities:
Procurement and contracting
Leads and undertakes procurement and contracting activities for complex requirements on behalf of the Canada Revenue Agency (CRA), in accordance with CRA’s corporate policy instruments, and national and international trade agreements within one of the following commodity groups:
 o Goods and tax programs support services;
 o Professional services;
 o Information technology
Provides expert contracting advice and guidance to CRA clients and vendors;Coordinates contracting and material management business line data and provides information in preparation for CRA reports for Parliament and Central Agencies including Access to Information and Privacy requests and Question Period responses;Investigates and analyses market trends and procurement practices to determine the appropriate procurement strategy, complex requirements. Identifies patterns and industry trends that affect assigned procurements. Provides options for procurement strategy considering a large number of factors including industry trends, legislative frameworks and regulations, client requirements, client budgets and timelines; andMonitors CRA activities related to materiel management and supply service processes to ensure programs and services are being effectively delivered within the respective contractual agreement.
Language requirements: English essential, Bilingual imperative BBB/BBB
The pool established from this staffing process may be used to staff similar positions.
To view the complete work description click here: SP0358.
If you cannot access the link, you may contact the email listed at the bottom of the notice to obtain a copy of the work description.
Come work for the CRA, one of the Top 100 Employers in Canada!
Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, public health recommendations and restrictions are in place across Canada and may change as circumstances evolve. You may be required to temporarily work remotely (e.g. from home). Further information will be provided if you are selected for the position.
To apply
Who can apply
Employees of the Canada Revenue Agency.
AND
Federal public service employees in organizations found under Schedules I, IV and V of the Financial Administration Act.
AND
Eligible veterans and Canadian Forces members
AND
Individuals with preferred status.
Applicants from the general public who do not meet the criteria required to apply on this staffing process will not be considered and will not be contacted.
Please note that this process will be used to staff positions located in the National Capital Region however remote working options may also be available.
We may give preference to the first 50 candidates who meet the staffing requirements. Additional candidates may be considered as needed.
Essential staffing requirements
To be eligible, you must meet the following requirements.
Education
The CRA’s minimum education standard for SP jobs requiring knowledge of supply-chain management:
Any degree from a recognized post-secondary institution*;
or
A three year diploma from a recognized postsecondary institution* in business administration, commerce, economics, materiel management, e business, logistics, or other specializations relevant to the position.
A recognized post-secondary institution is defined as a Canadian public or private institution that is recognized or authorized to grant degrees, diplomas, and other credentials by a public or private act of the provincial/territorial legislature or through a government-mandated quality assurance mechanism.
The institution must be listed in the Canadian Information Centre for International Credentials.
Acquired rights
Acquired rights for SP jobs requiring knowledge of supply-chain management.
Permanent incumbents of positions linked to these jobs, and all federal public service employees of the PG group who, on April 1, 2010, did not meet the minimum education standard are deemed to have met the minimum education standard based on their education, training, and/or experience.
Note: As well as your online application, if you have not done so already, you must upload into your Candidate Profile your essential education credentials by the closing date and time of this notice of job opportunity demonstrating that you meet the essential education requirements for the position(s) being staffed. Only official documents with the seal of the institution will be accepted, as such mark(s) transcript will not be accepted. Failure to do so may result in your application being rejected.
Experience:
You must clearly demonstrate on your application how you meet all of the four experiences listed below.
1. Experience* in performing contracting activities for complex** procurement files, including:
Planning a procurement process, and preparing procurement plans and approval documents;Developing solicitation and/or contractual documents, including statements of work and evaluation framework/criteria;Evaluating proposals or negotiating terms and conditions with vendors; andAwarding and managing contracts for goods and/or services.
2. Experience* in performing research, conducting analysis, analyzing risk, developing recommendations for the procurement and contracting of a commodity or for a program.
3. Experience* in providing oral and written advice, and recommendations to clients and/or management in the area of procurement and contracting.
4. Experience* in interpreting and applying legislation, regulations and policies with respect to procurement and contracting.
Experience is normally associated with performance of these functions as part of the major job duties accomplished for a period of not less than 36 cumulative months in the last five years.
**A complex procurement file is defined as having four or more of the following elements:
Included evaluation and selection based on price and technical criteriaRequired the establishment of point-rated evaluation criteria;Included assessing bids;Included resolving bid evaluation issues;Required negotiation of non-standard terms and conditions;Required negotiation to resolve contractual issues;Required resolving contract performance issues;Contained an e-catalogue component;Required approval of senior management committee(s) for high risk or high dollar value procurements.
You must provide separate narratives, one per file, for three files that you have worked on. Each narrative must demonstrate the four experiences listed above. Each narrative must include the dollar value and a description of the requirement, your contribution to the file, what difficulties or constraints were encountered and how they were resolved. To do so, you are allowed to attach one Word document with a limit of 15,000 characters in addition to the 3,000 characters allowed in the application tool. The Word document must have your name at the bottom of each page along with a page number and clearly show the experience you are referring to and submit the document to Cluster-Staffing Process / Regroupement-Processus de dotation (CRA/ARC) (Cluster_Selection_Process-Processus_de_selection_Regroupement@cra-arc.gc.ca).
You must provide the name and contact information of a supervisor and/or client who can validate the provided information.
Assessment
Essential
The essential staffing requirements indicated below will be assessed during the process and may be used to identify candidates for positions. Asset staffing requirements may also be assessed during the staffing process and may be used to identify candidates for positions. You will be notified in advance of any asset requirements to be evaluated.
Performance validationSecond Language validation (for bilingual positions)Korn Ferry mid-level multi-dimensional assessment (minimum pass mark of 55 for Global Assessment Score)
Results from locally developed assessment tools may be used for appointment; however, they are not portable to other staffing processes.
Due to COVID-19, assessment may be conducted virtually, over the phone, reference check, written exam, interview, etc.
Conditions of employment
Reliability/Security : Reliability Status, SecretValid Delegation of procurement authorities. Please note that those who do not have the delegation will need to successfully complete the process and be granted this authority normally within 1 year.Willingness to work overtimeWillingness to take and successfully complete training
Want to know more?
We encourage you to read Important information on staffing at the CRA to find out more about staffing processes and how to apply.

The CRA is committed to building a skilled, diverse workforce reflective of Canadian society. To find out more, consult Employment equity, diversity and inclusion at the CRA. We encourage you to complete the Employment Equity (EE) Staffing questionnaire as part of your application if you wish to be considered for staffing actions using the EE staffing requirement in this process. Your questionnaire response will be retained on file for the duration of the staffing process. If you do not complete the questionnaire, you will not be considered for any staffing actions using the EE staffing requirement in this process. If you decide to modify your response or fill out this questionnaire at a later date, please notify the contact listed at the bottom of this notice of job opportunity.

CRA employees support the economic and social well-being of Canadians, and build public trust. We have high expectations, and our employees are held to the standards of conduct outlined in our Code of integrity and professional conduct and Directive on conflict of interest, gifts and hospitality, and post-employment.
Information regarding the status of your application will be communicated via the candidate profile on the CRA Careers site. We strongly encourage you to verify the email address attached to your profile and to check your messages regularly for any updates

Company Overview
Sysco connects the world to share food and care for one another. Sysco leads from the heart of food and service to deliver the freshest foods and fresh ideas. Our customers can count on us to deliver on-point products and solutions since only Sysco is the global leader, sitting at the heart of innovation supply, delivery, culinary and more.
With over 69,000 associates, the company operates more than 320 distribution facilities worldwide and serves more than 650,000 customer locations. For fiscal 2019 that ended June 29, 2019, the company generated sales of more than $60 billion.
Sysco, one of Canada’s Best Employers 2019, as listed by Forbes, is dedicated to our global corporate social responsibility goals and to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. Join our winning team.
For more information, visit www.sysco.ca or follow us @SyscoCanada at facebook.com/SyscoCanada; twitter.com/SyscoCanada or instagram.com/SyscoCanada
For a full list of opportunities, visit www.sysco.ca/careers
Role:
The focus of this role is to analyze, cleanse and standardize existing data across our Canadian sites and tie in data from various IT systems within our organization. As well work with IT to model, test and implement new software systems and existing software enhancements to help with the standardizing efforts and train all field users.
Role Responsibilities:
Work with our various data query tools and databases to extract data and perform analysis to understand current data set up and develop strategies to standardize
Understand the data and make recommendations throughout project design and implementation to ensure data integrity
Closely work with internal business customers and IT to design, test and implement the data solution to meet various project demands and then train the end users
Review data and work with subject matter experts within the company as well as our vendor community to determine proper master data set up
Develop, maintain and automate data reports using reporting tool (such as IBM Cognos, SQL, Tableau, and Excel & Visual Basic)
Perform data cleansing on large datasets with focus on data quality
Work with IT to create Master Data Management environment and populate with standardized data
Work with sites across Canada to implement new master data within site environments and assess overall progress via reporting
Develop automated reports and Excel Macro tools for end users
Is willing to work safely with minimal environmental impact and understands the importance of reporting all hazards, incidents, and environmental spills immediately to their Supervisor.
Understands that they play an integral role in their own safety and that of their colleagues and is willing to speak out when hazards are present
Perform other duties as assigned
Qualifications/Skills/Job Requirements:
Minimum two (2+) years job related experience in Data Management and Business Analysis
Proven experience working with large amount of data and perform data cleansing
Post-Secondary degree/diploma in Business or Finance required
Bachelor’s degree or diploma in Finance, Business or Technology preferred
Experience with Merchandising, Finance and Pricing functions
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Tools including Word, Excel (Expert level), and Outlook as well as Cognos Impromptu and Powerplay (SPAR), AS400, and Internet applications
Understand concept of relational database, have experience with extracting data from various sources and perform analytical tasks
Work experience on projects in as asset
Understanding of VBA (or other coding tool) and experience with DB2 system and Microsoft SQL Server is an asset
Exposure to Informatica Data quality (or any other data quality tool) is an asset
Internal candidates apply via the Career Centre on your HR Portal / ADP Workforce Now.
External candidates submit cover letter & resume via www.sysco.ca/careers

We are hiring multiple new members for our Product Management team, building new software products and features. Our industry-leading software is used by more than 10,000 Emergency Medical Services (EMS) agencies, Fire Departments, Hospitals, and State agencies across North America.Depending on your level of experience and training, you will join us either as a Product Owner, or as an Associate Product Owner / Business Analyst. Reporting to one of our Product Managers or Product Directors, you will be part of our Product Management & Strategy team based in our Des Moines office.You will play a key role in translating our mission and product strategy into action by documenting product requirements and user stories, grooming and prioritizing a product backlog, and collaborating with a cross-functional agile development team as we design, build and ship new products and features.What You’ll Be Doing - the day to day**You will be instrumental in how we build innovative software, in close collaboration with team members in Product Management, Engineering and beyond:Interpret high level business and client requirements to create feature requirements, user stories, and relevant product backlog items which help solve some of the most exciting problems for our clientsOwn the prioritization and grooming of a product backlog, acting as the Product Owner in an agile development teamConduct analysis work and collaborate with developers and designers to understand and fine tune our backlog items ripe for the execution phase, including the creation of acceptance criteriaServe as the customer expert for the development team and always keeping customer needs at the forefront of everyone’s mindCollaborate with Product Managers, Product Owners, UX Designers and Business Analysts to ensure all features are built in a consistent and intuitive way that facilitates interoperability and data insights between different ESO productsPerform user acceptance testing to ensure releases achieve the stated goals and pass ESO’s high quality standards, in line with ESO’s missionWho You Are - the essentialsExperience working in Product Management roles (e.g., Business Analyst, Product Owner, Product Manager) in dynamic software companiesHistory working closely with design and development teams and ability to work collaboratively to achieve resultsExperience delving into the details and capability of considering the bigger pictureComfortable discussing creative ideas, new technology and user experienceBasic understanding of agile development methodologies (e.g., Scrum, Kanban)Strong written communication skills, especially making complicated user stories and acceptance criteria easy to understandProficiency in commonly used product management tools (e.g., JIRA, Confluence, Miro or similar)**Who You Are - the desirables (It’s a plus if you have):Formal product management training (e.g., Certified Scrum Product Owner, Pragmatic Institute, etc.)Experience in a fast-growing enterprise Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) technology company, ideally in a mission-critical environment where quality mattersAcademic degree in a related field (software engineering, computer science, business information systems, etc.)Demonstrated engagement in volunteer activities serving your community (e.g., volunteer firefighter, volunteer EMT, peer crisis counselling, etc.)Experience working in intercultural environments and collaborating with diverse teamsBenefits & Perks**ESO offers a comprehensive suite of benefits to promote health and financial security for our employees and their families. For full-time employment this includes:*Competitive health plan (medical, dental, & vision insurance)Front-loaded vacation and sick timeEmployee Assistance Program (EAP)Peace of mind benefits such as life insurance and disability insuranceCasual office environments and unlimited office snacks and drinksJob Type: Full-time

About the Opportunity
Rohit Group is currently looking for a full-time Business Analyst to join our team from our office in Edmonton, Alberta. As our new Analyst you will be responsible takes to provide thorough analysis from fragmented data and make solid recommendations on incoming deals' profitability and margins. The ideal Market Analyst candidate will have strong interpersonal communication skills with innovative ideas and a passion to find new ways to conduct business. They won't shy away from driving around the city to collect data on competition pricing and products. If you are willing to learn and grown in a challenging and exciting role, this job is for you.
What will you do in this role?
Collect and analyze large amounts of data regarding the housing market.
Assist in determining market pricing for all Rohit Communities product lines in Edmonton, Calgary, and Regina.
Maintain and manage price lists and communicate changes to relevant parties.
Provide feedback on the feasibility and profitability on incoming deals.
Act as the intermediary between outside sales staff and internal stakeholders.
Update Price Lists, Schedule B's and Change Orders.
Compile relevant sales information as directed.
Maintain current reports on Traffic, Sales Volumes, Inventory Status, and other relevant sales documents.
Filing, data entry, and maintenance of all contract documents.
Other duties as required.
What do we look for?
Completion of a degree, diploma, certificate in Math, Economics, Accounting, Commerce, or equivalent work experience.
2 to 5 years of experience in a fast-paced data analysis role.
Ability to work under pressure on multiple projects and meet tight deadlines is a must.
Proven success in a fast-paced, high volume workload environment with little to no supervision.
Experience in residential development/construction industry is a definite asset.
High proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Knowledge of building code and safety code requirements is an asset.
Basic knowledge of Alberta New Home Warranty policies is an asset.
Problem solving and critical thinking skills.
Self-motivation and the ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Detail and results orientated.
Consideration will be given to candidates that bring extensive experience in lieu of educational designations.
 Who are we?
Rooted in family values and entrepreneurial spirit, Rohit Group of Companies was founded in 1986 by Radhe Gupta. Together with his wife Krishna and son Rohit, Radhe grew the company from a small home builder to a diversified organization with operations in home building, residential and land development, residential rentals, commercial assets, and real estate lending.
This vertical integration has positioned Rohit Group as an award-winning industry leader in Western Canada with operations in Edmonton, Calgary, Fort McMurray, and Regina.
For more information, please visit our website
The Rohit Group celebrates diversity and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to an inclusive environment for all employees and applicants and will make all employment-related decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability or veteran status.

Should you require an accommodation during the application process, please click here to contact us with the position and location you are interested in.

Safety is a core value that guides everything we do. As such, all Rohitians are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 effective November 1, 2021. Employees may request an exemption due to medical condition(s) and other applicable human rights grounds.
Grow with us
As a valued member of our team, you will be awarded a competitive salary evaluated on knowledge, skills, and experience, plus:
$1,200 Annual Phone and Computer Allowances
Competitive Health, dental, vision, and life/disability insurance plans
$600 Annual Personal Wellness Spending Account
Encouragement and financial support for continuous learning & development programs and numerous opportunities for growth and mentorship
Corporate Wellness Program (recreational facilities, fitness, and health centers)
Employee discount program on Rohit products
100% Employer matched RRSP program
$2,000 per referred hire as part of our Employee Referral Bonus
And many more!
Experience. Opportunity. Efficiency. Integrity. Innovation. Perseverance. Balance. Leadership. These are the 8 core values that are at the heart of Rohit Group.
If our values resonate to you and are looking for an exciting opportunity and a rewarding career, look no further. We are always looking to add talented individuals to our team. Apply now!

We are Canada Life
Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.

Technology redefines the way we work and deliver to meet business needs and elevate the customer experience. You’ll be part of an organization that is embracing modern technology, innovation and agile ways of working.
Our Canada Technology team is a strategic partner in our business – with an ambition to be a forward-thinking, agile technology organization delivering secure, resilient and leading solutions that support Canada Life and the well-being of millions of Canadians.
The GC Tech Operations Business Systems Analyst is a key interface between various departments within the Group Customer business unit, in support of operations and delivering projects driven by Group Plan Sponsor Services.
The Business Systems Analyst will be responsible for collection, analysis and documentation of business requirements, needs and features, contribute to solutioning discussions and translate business needs and features into developer-consumable functional and non-functional requirements as an input to design, development and testing exercises associated with application support or configuration.
The successful candidate will develop a strong and deep understanding of Group Customer needs and how systems support the core business unit mission.
Accountabilities
Works closely with cross-departmental staff to understand how systems are used to support business functions.
Works with cross-departmental staff and management to analyze how existing systems may be improved to better support their business functions.
Works with vendors and cross-business unit staff to deliver new systems and technology solutions.
In conjunction with development staff, is responsible to plan and analyze data structures for internal and vendor business systems.
Writes detailed functional and non-functional specifications for developing or modifying various systems in use case or user story forms.
Prepares detailed workflow diagrams to specify operations performed by equipment and system applications and operations to be performed by personnel in system.
Reverse engineer the code to understand how current system supports different business processes.
Enforce application delivery methodologies, specifications and standards associated with CEO/CFO delivery controls and software development lifecycle.
Provide technical documentation and analysis, help administer or contribute to training for users, and support end users during the transition to maintenance period.
Participate in project planning, and estimation of requirements in small and testable pieces to promote Agile delivery practices.
Work with quality assurance and development resources to ensure understanding of the requirements and traceability of code, test plans and test cases back to business requirements.
Qualifications and Competencies:
Post-secondary Degree or equivalent experience in Information Technology.
5+ years of relevant experience or the equivalent in experience plus education.
Strong understanding of reverse engineering the code in C++, PL/SQL and .NET languages and web services.
Knowledge and practical experience working as part of an agile team is highly desirable.
Strong meeting facilitation and experience interviewing end-users skills for insight on functionality, interface, problems, and/or usability issues.
Proven analytical, quantitative, problem solving, and organizational skills.
Experience with requirements gathering and documentation of functional and non-functional specifications.
A self-starter who can work effectively as a member of a team or independently as the assignment requires.
Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to build strong relationships with internal clients, and a successful track record of collaboration toward achieving objectives expected.
Strong technical skills in Microsoft office (excel, access, word, PowerPoint, Outlook)
Ability to coordinate multiple tasks, set priorities, and meet deadlines.
Keen attention to detail and highly self motivated.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Ability to work well in a team environment and independently.
Flexible and adaptable in regard to learning and understanding new technologies.
Able to communicate effectively with non-technical staff and with members of interdisciplinary teams.
We offer a challenging, team-oriented work environment, competitive income and benefits, and opportunities for professional and personal development and growth.

About Solvera:

Solvera Solutions is a leader in the delivery of innovative IT solutions to the western Canadian market, helping our clients leverage the power of technology to achieve transformational growth.

We deliver a broad range of business and IT consulting services from five western Canadian locations. Service offerings include a combination of consulting services and solution services.

We pride ourselves on our client relationships and people practices and enjoy a very positive reputation as one of Canada’s Best Small and Medium Employers and a Best Managed Company.


Responsibilities:

Solvera Business Analysts work within a project team to provide professional services to our clients and assist them in meeting their business objectives. Solvera is currently recruiting for an experienced full-time Business Analyst to work on client engagements. We are looking for an energetic, results-oriented professional with the fundamental business analysis and consulting skills required to:

Conduct current state assessments of process, technology, organization and controls within a business or IT context, including process mapping and identifying gaps, issues, and improvement opportunities
Assist client stakeholders to define the desired future state, including the development of efficient, effective processes, process controls, and supporting technology and organizational structure
Facilitate stakeholder workshops
Develop operational metrics and frameworks for monitoring, measuring, and improving operational performance
Define business requirements that clearly convey business needs to both business and technical resources
Develop training material to support new processes, systems, roles and responsibilities
Conduct quality assurance and test planning, using both automated and manual methods
Proactively manage organizational change through effective stakeholder engagement and communication
Implement standards, processes and best practices at any level of an organization

Qualifications:
Completion of a post-secondary program in Business or Information Technology, with five or more years of business analysis experience, preferably in one or more of the following areas:
Enterprise Service Management
SAP implementations
SharePoint implementations
Application integration projects
Healthcare COTS and/or Integration
Custom software development
Vendor/Product Procurement Process
Superior facilitation techniques, written and verbal communication and relationship management skills
Ability to work well within a team environment to deliver to deadlines under pressure
Certification in Business Analysis or automated testing is an asset
Ability to work legally in Canada
Strong English language skills

Location Requirements:

Solvera consultants are hired into a specific location and generally spend the bulk of their consulting focus on clients within that geography, potentially with occasional assignments and travel supporting other locations.

Career Growth and Consulting Delivery:

Solvera’s consultants are assisted in their career growth by an assigned Client Executive, who fulfills the dual role of supporting team members on consulting assignments and guiding a person’s longer term performance achievement and career growth.

Solvera’s well-developed communities of interest structure connects all employees with their peers in the same discipline for knowledge-building and sharing, consulting competency development, professional development opportunities and team socializing.

Total Rewards

Solvera offers competitive base and variable pay, a highly-rated comprehensive benefits program and an outstanding organizational culture.
